title: Ticket #7502: Avoid blocking i/o in shared port daemon

The shared port daemon appears to blocked in recv() when the master kills it.

    1. There's a comment in SharedPortState::HandleResp() describing how this recv() is the only blocking part of the socket hand-off protocol, and how it's only necessary on Mac OS X 10.5.8, which is hilariously obsolete at this point.
      1. We should try disabling this code on all other platforms.
      2. We should test to see if this code is required at all (with newer MacOS X versions).
    2. Should we be worried that the master isn't picking up its sockets? Note that this hand-off occurs during DaemonKeepAlive::SendAliveToParent(), via ReliSock::do_shared_port_local_connect(). What was the master doing?
